reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The project aims to promote and support Palestinian reconciliation by continuing an informal framework for mid-level Palestinian political actors to discuss and produce concrete solutions to overcome the obstacles in the formal reconciliation process. The informal nature of the project allows maintaining dialogue and contributing to the activation of the official reconciliation track also during times of stagnation and impasse by creating a more positive atmosphere with regard to reconciliation and unity an d demonstrating that progress is possible and consensus can be reached among a diverse group of actors. The different types of dialogue workshops will convene Palestinian mid-level political actors from across the political and geographical spectrum in fac e-to-face interaction thus building confidence and trust among them. This will contribute to overall unity among the Palestinians. The diversity of participants broadens the base of actors involved in reconciliation related discussions thus contributing to a more participatory overall process. With the aim of increasing local ownership of the project results the continuation project will place emphasis on advocacy efforts by the stakeholder group helping to constructively channel popular calls for unity. Th e continuation builds on an ongoing project by CMI which has been implemented with the same target group. As in the previous phase the project will be implemented in cooperation with a local partner and in close coordination with Egypt the country mainly r esponsible for mediating the formal reconciliation process.
